Key Match Events: Dallas scored the first 13 points of the second half
Doncic, Klay Thompson and Irving hit consecutive 3-pointers during a 17-0 run in the first period
Pre-Game Insights: The Bulls played their second consecutive game without leading scorer Zach LaVine due to a right adductor strain
Dallas played without starting forward P.J. Washington due to a right knee sprain and without Dereck Lively II due to a right shoulder sprain
Post-Match Reflections: Nikola Vucevic had 14 points and 10 rebounds while sitting out the fourth quarter
Rookie Matas Buzelis had 13 points and nine rebounds
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Mavericks held their own inside, outscoring the Bulls 60-48 in the paint
The Bulls were on pace for their most 3-point shots this season at halftime with 27 but shooting 18.5%
Others: The Mavericks beat the Chicago Bulls 119-99
